banner.title: Learn and plan for your retirement
banner.text: It's never too early or too late to learn about your retirement options and plan for your future. Find out about public pensions, when to collect them and tips to consider for your retirement income.

learn.title: Learn
learn.heading: Get the most out of your Canadian public pensions
description: Learn about your retirement income options, and tips for your OAS/CPP pension choices.
Read the stories of retirees and their public pension decisions.

when-to-collect.title: Deciding when to start your public pensions
when-to-collect.description: Flexible public pensions offer choices for retirement. Learn how to choose and what to consider.

rules-of-thumb.title: Rules of thumb for your public pensions
rules-of-thumb.description: Check out these tips to help you decide when to start your public pensions. Choose what is right for you.

case-study-bonnie.title: Bonnie delays to reduce the savings she needs
case-study-bonnie.description: Bonnie will need less savings to retire comfortably if she delays her OAS pension and her CPP retirement pension.

plan.title: Plan
plan.heading: Not sure where to start? Take our quiz!
plan.description: Receive a personalized checklist to guide you through retirement.

retirement-income-calculator.title: Canadian Retirement Income Calculator
retirement-income-calculator.description: The Canadian Retirement Income Calculator will provide you with retirement income information. This includes the Old Age Security (OAS) pension and Canada Pension Plan (CPP) retirement benefits.

oas-eligibility-estimator.title: Old Age Security eligibility estimator
oas-eligibility-estimator.description: Find out how much money you may get from the Old Age Security program and its benefits.

apply.title: Apply
apply.heading: Ready to apply for your public pensions? Get started now

description.text: To apply online you can sign in or register for a My Service Canada Account (MSCA). To apply in-person or by mail, you can complete a paper application.

how-to-apply.title: Canada Pension Plan: How to apply

oas-apply.title: Old Age Security: How to apply

manage.title: Manage
manage.heading: Take control of your public pensions with the My Service Canada Account (MSCA)

description.text: You can do a lot with your MSCA, including:
list: Create and submit your Canada Pension Plan and Old Age Security application(s).
Check the status, payment dates and amounts for your public pensions.
Update your mailing address and banking information.

contact-us.title: Contact us
contact-us.description: There are many ways to reach us about your public pensions.

call-us.title: Call us
call-us.description: You can reach us at the following numbers:

toll-free.title: Telephone
toll-free.description: The hours of operation are 8:30 am to 5 pm local time, Monday to Friday.

outside.title: From outside Canada
outside.description: The hours of operation are 8:30 am to 5 pm Eastern time, Monday to Friday.

find-office.title: Find an office
find-office.link-text: Find a Service Canada office near you
